result.execSummary:
Odis Marcel Camp was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Odis Marcel Camp was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Odis Marcel Camp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Odis Marcel Camp not in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has been turned over to the State of ILLINOIS on July 7, 2022.
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.
Court Commissioner already signed the warrant. Additionally, case needs to be rescheduled b/c the Court is down.
Criminal Warrant for Commitment, signed and filed.

Defendant Odis Marcel Camp in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Odis Marcel Camp in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of *
Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Odis Marcel Camp
Current: 4314 N. 48th St., Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 06-25-2022)
Prior: 2125 North 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
